Articles.Content:
New release, 0.8.5.4

- Fixed initialization for new Unity version with KSP 1.8

I'm running KSP 1.8.1.2694 on Linux.  Installing just this mod (0.8.5.4) via <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> and it's dependencies:

Click thru blocker 0.1.95

Toolbar controller 0.1.9.4

Zero MiniAVC 1.1.0.1

Everything seems to work okay, except the icon doesn't change when I hit F6, so I can't tell if the mod is active or not.  Here's the [Player.log file.](http://wikisend.com/download/164884/Player.log)   

I see lots of lines like:

ToolbarControl: Cannot find texture to load:AutomatedScreenshots/PluginData/Textures/Auto-38

The actual directory name in GameData is AutomatedScreenShots (note the second capital S), so it looks like this is why the file is not found (Linux being case sensitive).  I can't move or link that directory (I get an error message at startup saying AutomatedScreenShots has been incorrectly installed), but if I create a new directory AutomatedScreenshots/PluginData/Textures with just the .png files from AutomatedScreenShots/PluginData/Textures, the F6 does toggle the camera icon (and screen shots are created).  (Crtl-F6 doesn't seem to do anything, but I don't need the auto-save functionality.)

New release, 0.8.5.5

- Added AssemblyFileVersion
- Updated version file for 1.12

New release, 0.8.5.6

- Fixed case of the mod directory when loading icons (from AutomatedScreenshots to AutomatedScreenShots), this was only a problem on Linux and sometimes Macs

New release, 0.8.5.7

- Fixed small memory leak
